qas.question: Thousands of years ago, dogs were depicted on the walls of what?
What scenes were popular in art during the Middle Ages?
Dogs were depicted as art on the walls of what?
What kind of art scene was popular in the Middle Ages?
As relationships between people and dogs got closer, what happened to the art that had dogs in it?

context: Cultural depictions of dogs in art extend back thousands of years to when dogs were portrayed on the walls of <a0_0><a2_0>caves<a2_0/>.<a0_0/> Representations of dogs <a4_0>became more elaborate<a4_0/> as individual breeds evolved and the relationships between human and canine developed. <a1_0><a3_0>Hunting<a1_0/> scenes<a3_0/> were popular in the Middle Ages and the Renaissance. Dogs were depicted to symbolize guidance, protection, loyalty, fidelity, faithfulness, watchfulness, and love.
